metadata.title: Real-time and Historical Marine Meteorological Data from NOAA's National Data Buoy Center (NDBC)
metadata.description:
NOAA's National Data Buoy Center offers real-time and historical data
from its 114 moored buoys and C-MAN (Coastal-Marine Automated Network)
stations.  Data is transmitted hourly via the Geostationary
Operational Environmental Satellites (GOES).

All stations measure wind speed and direction, wind gust, barometric
pressure and air temperature.  All buoys and some C-MAN stations
measure sea surface temperature, wave height, and wave period.
Monthly and annual climatic summary tables are available.

Stations are located throughout U.S. coastal waters including
U.S. Atlantic coast, U.S. Pacific coast, Gulf of Alaska, Bering Sea,
Gulf of Mexico, Great Lakes and Hawaiian Islands.  Some stations are
also located in the western equatorial Pacific.

Real-time data is available hourly.  After several days, data is
quality-controlled and appended to daily data files.  An archive of
monthly data may also be accessed.  The following types of
quality-controlled data are available: standard meteorological data,
acoustic Doppler current profiler (ADCP) data, continuous winds data,
spectral wave density data, spectral wave direction data, water level
data, and surface ocean current data.

Data is available through NDBC's WWW server using the station locator
map or the station ID list and search:
http://seaboard.ndbc.noaa.gov


Telnet, FTP and BBS service is also available:

"telnet://seaboard.ndbc.noaa.gov"

Anonymous FTP: ftp://seaboard.ndbc.noaa.gov

and give email address as the password

BBS phone number: 601-688-7938
modem settings: 8 data bits, no parity, and 1 stop bit, up to 28.8 Kbps

[This summary was derived from the NDBC WWW pages and Earth System
Monitor Vol. 5, No. 4, June 1995.]
metadata.notes:
Purpose: To record the real-time and Historical Marine Meteorological Data from NOAA's National Data Buoy Center (NDBC)

Status: Complete

Maintenance frequency: As Needed

Access constraints: Unless specifically annotated otherwise, and may be used freely by the public.

Use constraints: Real-time data has undergone gross error checking only.  Use real-time data with discretion.

Distribution liability: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.

NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
